products.name: Peace Lily Plant
products.description: A beautiful indoor plant
products.about: The Peace Lily plant is a stunning indoor flowering plant with dark, glossy green leaves and occasional pearly white flowers that put any competitors to shame. Known to be one of the best air-purifying plants, the Peace Lily is a wonderful indoor companion with a fuss-free attitude and low maintenance requirements. It is also fairly fast-growing, making it the perfect lush plant for indoor displays.

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water your Peace Lily when the top 1-2 inches of soil feel dry to the touch. Be careful not to overwater, as this can cause root rot. It prefers to be kept consistently moist but not waterlogged.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Peace Lilies thrive in bright, indirect light. While they can tolerate lower light conditions, they will bloom best in brighter settings. Avoid placing them in direct sunlight as this can scorch the leaves.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Peace Lilies prefer moderate to high humidity but can tolerate average indoor humidity. You can mist the leaves or place them on a humidity tray to help improve growth.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: The Peace Lily prefers temperatures between 65°F to 80°F (18°C to 27°C). It does not tolerate cold drafts or temperatures below 50°F (10°C).

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Peace Lilies are toxic to pets if ingested. Keep them out of reach of animals, especially cats and dogs, to avoid any risk of poisoning.

Category.name: Indoor Plants
Category.description: Peace Lilies are low-maintenance indoor plants known for their air-purifying qualities and beautiful white blooms. They thrive in low light and require minimal care, making them ideal for homes and offices.

products.name: Brazilian Wood Plant
products.description: A beautiful indoor plant
products.about: Looking for a unique addition to your home garden? Then the Dracaena fragrans Brazil Wood plant is just what you need! At first glance, this plant may not specifically stand out.But the more you get to know about it, the more you will gravitate towards it. This stunning Dracaena is just a wooden log at first but as you nurture it, it grows stunning leaves from different nodes that sprout wonderfully. This can then grow in height as well and become the most beautiful plant you’ve seen, giving you a unique and lush display in your home or garden.

Tips.title: Water twice a week
Tips.content: Always check your plants before watering, the topsoil should be dry to touch. For succulents allow the potting mix to dry completely before watering again.

Tips.title: Water
Tips.content: Water your Brazil Wood plant when the top 50% of the soil is dry. This plant is drought tolerant, so it’s better to let the soil dry out a bit between waterings.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: The Brazil Wood plant prefers higher humidity levels, but it can tolerate average humidity levels.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: The Brazil Wood plant prefers temperatures between 65-80°F (18-27°C). It can tolerate temperatures as low as 50°F (10°C).

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: The Brazil Wood plant is toxic to pets and humans if ingested. Keep it out of reach of pets and children.

products.name: Anthurium Red Plant
products.description: Anthurium Red: Low-maintenance, vibrant red blooms, perfect for indoor spaces.
products.about: Anthurium Red or the Flamingo plant is a low-maintenance plant with heart-shaped red waxy blooms that last up to eight weeks. They bloom profusely for more than 250 days a year with bright indirect light and without any special attention and are the perfect size for any indoor area with their bright and shiny presence.

Tips.title: Water twice a week
Tips.content: Always check your plants before watering, the topsoil should be dry to touch. For succulents allow the potting mix to dry completely before watering again.

Tips.title: Water
Tips.content: Water your Brazil Wood plant when the top 50% of the soil is dry. This plant is drought tolerant, so it’s better to let the soil dry out a bit between waterings.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: The Brazil Wood plant prefers higher humidity levels, but it can tolerate average humidity levels.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Place your plants on window sills where it can get the brightest possible indirect light. Bright indirect light is when the plant is within a couple of feet of a natural source of light.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: The plant causes no harm to your pets on contact or ingestion, However, consuming indoor plants is not beneficial to their heath.

products.name: The China Doll Plant - XL
products.description: China Doll Tree: Glossy leaves, easy-care, forest-like indoor aesthetic.
products.about: With its glossy green leaves and large growth, this indoor China Doll plant is basically a tree. The woody branches of the Radermachera sinica complement its dark green leaves perfectly, creating the most wonderful indoor aesthetics. Interestingly, the plant being called the China Doll Tree has nothing to do with the country but everything to do with the fact that the tree looks - quite literally - like a doll house tree. The best part? This plant is relatively easy to care for and adds an instant forest-like feel to any space, serving as an excellent plant for balconies and patios.

Tips.title: Water twice a week
Tips.content: Always check your plants before watering, the topsoil should be dry to touch. For succulents allow the potting mix to dry completely before watering again.

Tips.content: The plant causes no harm to your pets on contact or ingestion, However, consuming indoor plants is not beneficial to their heath.

products.name: Aglaonema Pink Beauty Plant
products.description: Aglaonema Pink Beauty: Low-maintenance, colorful pink leaves, perfect for low light.
products.about: If you are a first time gardener looking for an easy one, Aglaonema Pink Beauty is the plant for you. Also called the Chinese Evergreen, it will stay happy and beautiful in low indirect light with little water. Its bright pink leaves add the right amount of jazz and colour to any space and décor. A stunner with its pretty pink foliage both alone and in plant clusters.

products.name: English Ivy Plant In Hanging Planter
products.description: English Ivy: Glossy leaves, fast-growing, perfect for containers.
products.about: Growing English Ivy indoors is pure unadulterated joy with its quirkily shaped leaves that are both glossy and fleshy. The leaves are a beautiful dark green in colour and grow profusely on rapidly spreading vines and will easily climb walls and race across ground. They grow exceedingly well in containers and look beautifully tropical and lush in hanging planters.

products.description: Peperomia Green Creeper: Glossy, heart-shaped, pet-friendly, low-maintenance trailing plant.
products.about: The hanging Peperomia Green Creeper plant boasts glossy green heart-shaped leaves on thick trailing stems. Excellent for both table tops and trellises, the trailing vines of the hanging Peperomia plant stunning in vertical displays. products.description: Turtle Vine: Fast-growing, low-maintenance hanging plant.
products.about: The Turtle Vine Plant is a delicate perennial that grows quickly and profusely with minimum care. If you are a gardening novice and want to add beautiful hanging plants that require minimum care, the turtle vine is your answer. This resilient variety thrives in bright indirect light and grows with abandon and is extremely easy to propagate.

products.name: Broken Heart Plant
products.description: Philodendron Broken Heart: Easy-care, heart-shaped leaves, trailing vines.
products.about: One of the most popular houseplants, and our all-time bestseller, this easy-growing plant with its heart-shaped leaves is loved for its beautiful fenestrations. Quick to grow with delicate trailing vines that can be styled for every space, the Philodendron broken heart is the monstera charm you want to add to your home if you don't have the space for the huge monstera. Scientifically known as the Monstera adansonii, this broken heart plant thrives indoors in bright indirect light and with very little care.

products.name: Variegated Jade Mini Plant
products.description: Variegated Jade: Lucky, low-maintenance plant with colorful leaves.
products.about: The more colorful relative of the Jade plant, this variegated Jade plant is an absolute beauty indoors. With its small fleshy, coin-shaped leaves growing on reddish-brown stems, the variegated Jade is a versatile and stunning houseplant, capable of effortlessly brightening up every corner of your home. Low maintenance and lucky, the Variegated Jade Mini Plant is a popular indoor plant worldwide due to its positive connotations in the worlds of Vastu and Feng Shui. It is said to bring money and prosperity to its keepers and also makes for the perfect, fuss-free house companion.

Tips.title: Water twice a week
Tips.content: Always check your plants before watering, the topsoil should be dry to touch. For succulents allow the potting mix to dry completely before watering again.

Tips.title: Water
Tips.content: Always check your plants before watering, the topsoil should be dry to touch. For succulents allow the potting mix to dry completely before watering again.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: The plant prefers higher humidity levels, but it can tolerate average humidity levels.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Place your plants on window sills where it can get the brightest possible indirect light. Bright indirect light is when the plant is within a couple of feet of a natural source of light.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: The plant causes no harm to your pets on contact or ingestion, However, consuming indoor plants is not beneficial to their heath.

products.name: Monstera Deliciosa Plant
products.description: ropical, fenestrated leaves; stylish indoor plant.
products.about: Also called the Swiss Cheese Plant, the Monstera Deliciosa is a tropical stunner brought indoors. With large leaves and wonderful fenestrations that resemble a Swiss cheese slice, this plant has easily become one of the crowd-favorites. If you’re looking for an indoor plant that will effortlessly and instantly uplift your home decor, the Monstera Plant should be your go-to!

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water your Monstera when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. Be careful not to overwater; the plant prefers slightly moist, well-draining soil.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Monstera thrives in bright, indirect light. While it can tolerate lower light, its growth may slow, and the leaves might not develop their iconic fenestrations.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Monstera enjoys higher humidity but can adapt to average indoor humidity levels. If possible, mist the leaves or place it on a humidity tray for optimal growth.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Place your Monstera in warm conditions, ideally between 65°F to 85°F (18°C to 29°C). Avoid placing it in cold drafts or near air conditioning vents.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Monstera Deliciosa is toxic to pets. Avoid allowing pets to chew on the plant, as it can cause irritation or discomfort.

products.name: Peperomia Green Plant
products.description: Low-maintenance, air-purifying, stylish, succulent-like plant.
products.about: Low maintenance, air purifying, and super classy with its delicate looks, the Peperomia Green plant is the perfect indoor houseplant. Its succulent-like leaves mean you don’t have to water it too often and its stunning aesthetics allow you to decorate with it all throughout your house. Talk about versatile and easy to maintain - the Peperomia obtusifolia has it all!

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water the Peperomia when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. Allow the soil to dry out between waterings to prevent root rot.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Peperomia thrives in bright, indirect light but can tolerate lower light conditions. Avoid direct sunlight to prevent leaf burn.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Peperomia prefers moderate humidity levels but can adapt to average indoor humidity. Light misting or using a humidity tray can help promote growth.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Keep your Peperomia in temperatures between 60°F to 80°F (16°C to 27°C). It does well in warm, indoor environments away from drafts.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Peperomia Green Plant is non-toxic to pets, making it a safe choice for homes with cats and dogs.

products.name: Areca Palm Plant
products.description: Pet-friendly, air-purifying, tropical, easy-growing palm.
products.about: Once an endangered species, the Areca Palm is a staple in Indian spaces. One of the most undervalued plants in the indoor plant category. This excellent air purifier is pet-friendly and easy to grow. Its delicate leaves/fronds grow outwards in a curved manner and add a tropical feel to any space and can adapt to a variety of growing conditions.

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water the Areca Palm when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. Ensure the pot has good drainage to avoid waterlogging. Be careful not to overwater.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: The Areca Palm prefers bright, indirect light but can adapt to moderate light. Avoid direct sunlight as it may scorch the fronds.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Areca Palm thrives in higher humidity levels. If your home is dry, consider misting the fronds or placing the plant on a humidity tray.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: This tropical plant prefers warm temperatures, ideally between 65°F to 75°F (18°C to 24°C). Avoid placing it in cold drafts or near heating vents.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: The Areca Palm is non-toxic to pets, making it an ideal choice for homes with cats and dogs.

products.name: Lucky Bamboo Plant - 3 Layer
products.description: Easy-care, lucky plant; perfect for gifting and Feng Shui.
products.about: Easy to grow and care for, the Lucky Bamboo 3-layered plant is a popular indoor plant because of more reasons than just its care requirements. According to Feng Shui, this is one of the best lucky plants for homes, and its reputation as such greatly adds to its charm and allure. Additionally, it is also a great gifting option that works as a personal pick-me-up!

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water your Lucky Bamboo when the water level in the container is low. Make sure the roots are always submerged, and change the water every 1-2 weeks to prevent bacteria growth.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Lucky Bamboo thrives in bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight, which can burn the leaves. It can also grow in low light conditions, but slower.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Lucky Bamboo enjoys moderate to high humidity. If the air in your home is dry, consider misting the leaves regularly or placing it near a humidifier.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: The Lucky Bamboo plant prefers warm temperatures, between 65°F to 90°F (18°C to 32°C). Avoid placing it in a location with cold drafts or extreme temperature fluctuations.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Lucky Bamboo is non-toxic to pets, making it a safe and decorative choice for homes with animals.

products.name: Money Plant Golden
products.description: Versatile, low-maintenance, evergreen Money Plant with cascading vines.
products.about: A beloved indoor plant around the world, the Money Plant Golden is every gardener’s favorite and with very good reason! Highly adaptable, versatile, low maintenance, and timeless, the Money Plant Golden graces almost every garden, everywhere. This plant can survive some periods of neglect and continue to grace your gardens with an evergreen elegance. Its growth patterns also allow it to grow well as a cascading vine or a creeping plant when trained.

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water your Money Plant when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. The plant prefers moist, but well-draining soil, so be careful not to overwater.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Money Plant Golden thrives in bright, indirect light but can also tolerate low light. However, its growth may slow down in low light conditions.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: The plant is adaptable to most humidity levels but thrives in moderate to high humidity. Mist occasionally or place it on a humidity tray to improve growth.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Money Plant Golden prefers a temperature range between 65°F to 85°F (18°C to 29°C). Avoid cold drafts and temperatures below 50°F (10°C).

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Money Plant Golden is toxic to pets if ingested, so it's best to keep it out of reach of curious animals.

products.name: Golden Sedum Plant
products.description: Golden, tufty Sedum plant for decor.
products.about: Sedum plants are golden-green, tufty perennial plants with leaves clustered on thick stems. These chubby, golden Sedum plants grow horizontally rather than vertically and are popularly planted in clusters. Their foliage is attractively golden and padded, making them eye candy for anyone looking to add minimalist plants to their home decor.

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Sedum plants are drought-tolerant, so only water when the soil is completely dry. Avoid overwatering as it can lead to root rot. Allow the soil to dry out thoroughly between waterings.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Golden Sedum thrives in bright, indirect sunlight. It can tolerate some direct sunlight, but too much can scorch the leaves. Place it in a sunny spot for the best growth.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Sedum plants are quite adaptable to various humidity levels. They prefer dry air and do not require additional humidity. Avoid misting or placing them in overly humid areas.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Golden Sedum prefers temperatures between 60°F to 80°F (15°C to 27°C). Avoid exposing it to extreme temperature fluctuations or cold drafts.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Golden Sedum is non-toxic to pets, making it a safe choice for households with cats and dogs.

Category.name: Succulent Plants
Category.description: Succulent plants are low-maintenance, drought-tolerant, and perfect for adding a touch of greenery with minimal care. Golden Sedum is a wonderful addition to any home decor.

products.name: Snake Plant - Golden Hahnii
products.description: Compact, low-maintenance Sansevieria with golden-yellow variegated leaves.
products.about: A dwarf variety of the famed Snake Plant family, the Sansevieria Golden Hahnii sports beautiful variegated, sword-like leaves with dark green bands and bright, golden-yellow borders. This low maintenance plant is so resilient that it is practically impossible to kill, making it the perfect fit for new and busy gardeners! Additionally, its compact size makes it an excellent choice for office desks and small spaces.

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water only when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. Sansevieria prefers infrequent watering. Overwatering can lead to root rot.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Golden Hahnii thrives in bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light. Avoid direct sunlight to prevent the leaves from burning.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Sansevieria is adaptable to most humidity levels and thrives in dry air. It doesn’t require misting, making it perfect for dry indoor environments.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Golden Hahnii does well in temperatures between 60°F to 85°F (16°C to 29°C). Keep it away from cold drafts and avoid temperatures below 50°F (10°C).

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Snake Plants are mildly toxic to pets if ingested, so it's best to keep them out of reach of animals.

Category.name: Indoor Plants
Category.description: Snake Plants, including the Golden Hahnii variety, are low-maintenance, resilient, and perfect for adding a touch of greenery to small spaces. They are known for their air-purifying properties and can thrive in a variety of lighting conditions.

products.name: Ficus Lyrata Bambino -XL
products.description: Ficus Lyrata: Lush, air-purifying, magazine-worthy plant.
products.about: The coolest kid on the block and an Instagram superstar, the Ficus Lyrata or the Fiddle Leaf Fig is a tropical plant that is also a great air purifier. This tall lush plant is a show-stealer in any home. Give it a spot with enough light and proper watering and it will gift you with beautiful broad leaves that will make your space worthy of a magazine feature. Get it home.

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water the Ficus Lyrata Bambino when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. Avoid overwatering, as this can lead to root rot. Ensure the pot has proper drainage.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Ficus Lyrata Bambino thrives in bright, indirect light but can tolerate some direct sunlight. Avoid low light conditions, as they may lead to poor growth and leaf drop.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Ficus Lyrata Bambino prefers moderate to high humidity levels. It will do well with occasional misting or being placed on a humidity tray.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Ficus Lyrata Bambino prefers warm temperatures between 65°F to 75°F (18°C to 24°C). Keep it away from drafts and heating or cooling vents.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Ficus Lyrata Bambino is toxic to pets if ingested, so it's best to keep it out of reach of animals.

Category.name: Indoor Plants
Category.description: Ficus Lyrata Bambino, also known as the Fiddle Leaf Fig, is a lush, low-maintenance indoor plant. Known for its large, broad leaves, it thrives with proper care and lighting. This plant is ideal for creating a striking, tropical look in any indoor space.

products.name: Ficus Moclame Plant - XL
products.description: Glossy-leaved Ficus Moclame, perfect indoor plant.
products.about: The Ficus Moclame (Ficus Microcarpa) is an evergreen indoor plant from the fig family native to Southern Asia. Also, famous as Indian Laurel, Pot Belly Fig, Chinese Banyan, Malayan Banyan, and Curtain Fig. While in the wild, Ficus Moclame can grow into 50 feet tall trees, indoors they only grow to six feet. Famous for their thick, round leaves with a glossy finish that distinguishes it from its more famous cousins like the weeping fig and the fiddle-leaf fig. The Moclame plant needs partial to bright indirect light and can be placed near a south or west-facing window for large, impressive foliage.

Tips.title: Watering
Tips.content: Water the Ficus Moclame when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. Avoid overwatering, as this can lead to root rot. Ensure the pot has proper drainage.

Tips.title: Light
Tips.content: Ficus Moclame thrives in bright, indirect light but can tolerate some direct sunlight. Avoid low light conditions, as they may lead to poor growth and leaf drop.

Tips.title: Humidity
Tips.content: Ficus Moclame prefers moderate to high humidity levels. It will do well with occasional misting or being placed on a humidity tray.

Tips.title: Temperature
Tips.content: Ficus Moclame prefers warm temperatures between 65°F to 75°F (18°C to 24°C). Keep it away from drafts and heating or cooling vents.

Tips.title: Toxicity
Tips.content: Ficus Moclame is toxic to pets if ingested, so it's best to keep it out of reach of animals.

Category.name: Indoor Plants
Category.description: Ficus Moclame, also known as the Indian Laurel or Curtain Fig, is a low-maintenance indoor plant known for its glossy, thick leaves. Perfect for bright spaces, it thrives with minimal care and adds a lush, tropical feel to any home.
